name: castle_siege
title: Castle Siege
description: Throw fireballs at a target, use the mouse pointer to aim and the spacebar to choose the power

steps.title: Making a fireball
steps.description: Make a fireball to throw around your stage

components.text: Open the **Scratch Starter Project**
Make the fireball point towards the players mouse until they press the space bar using the following code

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
		wait (0.5) secs
		go to x:(-200) y:(-100)
		point in direction (90 v)
		switch costume to [fireball-aim v]
		repeat until <key [space v] pressed?>
			point towards [mouse-pointer v]
		end

components.text: **Click the green flag** - Does your fireball follow the mouse until you press the space bar?

steps.title: Setting the fireball power
steps.description: Allow the player to deicde on how powerful the fireball should be thrown

components.text: Create a new variable called `power`
Right-click (or hold Shift and left-click) on the variable display and click `slider`
Drag the variable display to the bottom of the stage, near the fireball
Add this line to your existing code to set your new `power` variable to 0 when the flag is clicked
Use the following script to **set the power of the fireball** *after the direction has been chosen*

components.blocks:
repeat until < not <key [space v] pressed?> >
			change [power v] by (1)
			wait (0.1) secs
		end

components.text: This code means that you have to **keep the space bar held down** after choosing the direction, to choose the fireball's power
**Click the green flag** - Can you choose the fireball angle and power?

steps.title: Throwing the fireball
steps.description: Allow the player to throw the fireball once its direction and power are selected

components.text: Add the following code to the end of your fireball script to broadcast that you're throwing a fireball
Add the following script to your fireball, to move until it reaches the edge of the stage

components.blocks:
when I receive [throw v]
		switch costume to [fireball v]
		repeat until < touching [edge v]? >
			move (power) steps
		end
		hide

components.text: Add this block to the begining of your fireball script to `show` the fireball
**Click the green flag** - Can you make your fireball move at different angles and different speeds?

steps.title: Limit throw power
steps.description: Limit your fileball power throw power

components.text: Change your fireball code so that the fireball can't be thrown with a power greater than 20

components.blocks:
repeat until< not <key [space v] pressed?> >
			if < (power) < [20] > then
				change [power v] by (1)
				wait (0.1) secs
			end
		end

components.text: Right-click on your power variable, and click 'set slider min and max' to **set the maximum value for the variable's slider**
**Click the green flag** - Check that the power never gets above 20

steps.title: Reduce power during flight
steps.description: Make your fireball power reduce during flight

components.text: **Change your fireballs flight code** to slow down the fireball as it flies through the air

components.blocks:
when I receive [throw v]
		switch costume to [fireball v]
		repeat until < touching [edge v]? >
			move (power) steps
		change [power v] by (-0.25)
		end
		hide

components.text: **Click the green flag** - Does your fireball eventually move backwards?
To stop your fireball travelling backwards change the code so that the power is only lowered if it is above 0

components.blocks:
if < (power) > (0) > then
			change [power v] by (-0.25)
		end

components.text: **Click the green flag** - Check that the fireball flies and does not move backwards

steps.title: Add Gravity
steps.description: Make your fileball fall towards the ground

components.text: Add gravity by moving the fireball down continuously during flight with the following script

components.blocks:
when I receive [throw v]
		repeat until <touching [edge v]?>
			change y by (-5)
		end

components.text: **Click the green flag** - Does your fireball move much more realistically?

steps.title: The target
steps.description: Let's add in a target for your fireballs!

components.text: + Add in another sprite to your project.

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
		forever
			if < touching [fireball v]? > then
				say [You got me!] for (1) secs
			end
		end
components.text: Add this code to your new sprite, so that it says "You got me!" when it gets hit:
Test out your new code.

Let's do a couple of things to make the game harder. First, let's move the bear each time the player throws the fireball.

	To do this, first add a `broadcast` loop. This will let your bear know that a new shot is about to be taken.

components.blocks:
when I receive [new shot v]
		set x to (pick random (0) to (200))
components.text: When your bear receives this message, move it to a new random position with this code:
Test your project by throwing a few fireballs. Does your bear move position each time?
You can also make your game harder by adding a rock in front of your fireball.
